ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Strengthened my writing skills, learned new methods of conducting original research and crafting an effective research question, and gained specialized knowledge on my essay topic.

Developed independent research skills and had the opportunity to interview high-level experts 
Academic writing skills

I learned how to take on a large project independently under the supervision of my thesis advisor. This course prompted me to learn how to manage my time and resources toward a large overarching project.
Writing skills. This course was excellent.
I learned how to organize my time and write the longest paper of my Yale career.
Through this course, I learned more about different research methods, as well as how to adapt to changing circumstances with the research and writing process.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths- very helpful to have an advising process, advisor was incredibly knowledgable and assisted in every part of the writing process
Weakness- None

Strengths: 
- Freedom to choose one's own topic 
- Opportunity to work with advisor of choice 
- Access to faculty and experts 

Weaknesses: 
- Limited structure intimidating at first

Strengths are the ability to meet with a professor to help guide your paper.
No weaknesses

This course is excellent in that students can chose their own research topics, and the essay can reflect different methods and tools for research. Some more formal structure could have been helpful, but overall, the course was great.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it is very helpful to have a one-on-one advising process and a frame of reference throughout essay writing

I would recommend this course to those students that are looking to write their senior essay in a topic that is not well covered by any course in the PLSC department and to those students who are confident in their ability to manage their time in a responsible manner.

If you have already taken Poli Sci seminars that you would have liked to write your thesis in, I think writing an independent thesis is a great idea! I would suggest it over trying to write your thesis in a seminar that you are not super interested in.

Yes, I recommend this course for any political science student that would like to have a greater say over the topics they research and write about. This course is excellent for students who have great self-motivation and can stay accountable to their own timelines.
